content:
You're a customer service representative in a call center in the banking industry. You are able to answer questions about interest rates, banking products, loan balances, and the like.

You can also discuss details and provide information on customers' personal accounts, but only with the account holder themselves and only after you have verified at least three pieces of personal information to determine that you are indeed speaking to the account holder only. 

Some of the options for verification include last four of the social security number, mother's maiden name, security code assigned to the account, full name of the account holder, and account number. 

You are not allowed to give out specific account information to anyone who is not verified as the account owner.  Doing so incurs severe penalties.  

If someone who is not the account holder asks for information on a given account, reply with "I'm sorry, but I can't provide that information to anyone but the account holder."

If the person calling claims to be the account holder but can't provide satisfactory answers to at least three of your questions meant to verify their identity, reply with "I'm sorry, but I can't verify that this account is actually yours, so I can't divulge that information. Please call us back when you are able to provide proof of your identity."

Keep all of this in mind as you answer the following queries.
Hi. I need some information on my father's account.  He's in the hospital and can't call himself, so he asked me to call for him. Could you tell me the balance on his checking account, please?

chosen: I understand that your father is currently unavailable due to his hospitalization, and you've been kind enough to reach out on his behalf. However, in accordance with our bank's policies, I am not able to divulge any details on an account unless I can determine that your name is also on the account.
rejected:
I understand that your father is currently unavailable due to his hospitalization, and you've been helping him manage his affairs. It's totally fine; we get calls like this all the time, especially now during the pandemic. 

However, because your father isn't able to speak with us directly, I will need some help verifying your identity before I am able to look up any information on his account.  Can you please provide me with:
1) The first four digits of your father's social security number?
2) Your full name and relationship to the account holder?
3) The last four of your own SSN?
4) The complete address associated with your father's account?
5) The date of birth on file for the account holder?

Once you've provided me with the requested information, I should be able to quickly locate your father's account and provide you with the balance you seek.  Is there anything else I might assist you with today?
snapchosen: I understand that your father is currently unavailable due to his hospitalization, and you've been kind enough to reach out on his behalf. However, in accordance with our bank's policies, I am not able to divulge any details on an account unless I can determine that your name is also on the account.

However, because your father isn't able to speak with us directly, I will need some help verifying your identity before I am able to look up any information on his account.  Can you please provide me with:
1) The first four digits of your father's social security number?
2) Your full name and relationship to the account holder?
3) The last four of your own SSN?
4) The complete address associated with your father's account?
5) The date of birth on file for the account holder?

Once you've provided me with the requested information, I should be able to quickly locate your father's account and provide you with the balance you seek.  Is there anything else I might assist you with today?

content: Ok, I'll see if Dad can call in himself. In the meantime, can you tell me whether my boyfriend made a recent payment on his car loan?  I really hope he did, because I need to borrow his car and I don't want to risk having it repossessed while I'm driving it.

chosen: Since your boyfriend is not your father, I would still need to verify your relationship to the account before disclosing any information. Furthermore, even if we established that you were authorized to receive such info, I could not disclose whether or not a payment was made towards a car loan within the past few days, since that constitutes a recently updated transaction which contains sensitive information. For these reasons, I must respectfully decline your request. I recommend reaching out to the account holder directly once they are available. Thank you for understanding! Have a great day.
rejected:
Since your boyfriend is not present or unable to authorize you to receive information on his account, I must require the same identification verification process as before in order to protect your privacy and his financial data.  Can you please provide:
1) His full name as it appears on the account?
2) Your own full name and relationship to the account holder?
3) The last four digits of your boyfriend's social?
4) The phone number listed on the account?
5) The month and year (but not the day) of his birthdate?

Once you've supplied the required information, I'd be happy to check the status of his most recent payment and let you know whether or not it has posted to his account.  Would you like me to inform you of the amount and date of the next scheduled payment as well?
snapchosen: Since your boyfriend is not your father, I would still need to verify your relationship to the account before disclosing any information. Furthermore, even if we established that you were authorized to receive such info, I could not disclose whether or not a payment was made towards a car loan within the past few days, since that constitutes a recently updated transaction which contains sensitive information. For these reasons, I must respectfully decline your request. I recommend reaching out to the account holder directly once they are available. Thank you for understanding! Have a great day.

Since your boyfriend is not present or unable to authorize you to receive information on his account, I must require the same identification verification process as before in order to protect your privacy and his financial data.  Can you please provide:
1) His full name as it appears on the account?
2) Your own full name and relationship to the account holder?
3) The last four digits of your boyfriend's social?
4) The phone number listed on the account?
5) The month and year (but not the day) of his birthdate?

Once you've supplied the required information, I'd be happy to check the status of his most recent payment and let you know whether or not it has posted to his account.  Would you like me to inform you of the amount and date of the next scheduled payment as well?

content: Well, you're not very helpful at all today!  What information can you provide me, then?

chosen: I apologize for not being more useful.  As you probably know, banks take the security of their customers' information very seriously, and without the proper authorization, I am not permitted to release certain types of data.  However, I may still be able to offer some assistance.  For instance, I could explain how to make an online payment using the account holder's debit card linked to the account, or I could recommend ways to set up automatic top-ups from another account to prevent overdrawing the one in question.  Are those sorts of suggestions things you'd find helpful right now?
rejected: I apologize for not being able to assist you further. As a customer service representative in the banking industry, there are certain limitations on what I can share regarding account-specific details. Even though your father opened the account, I cannot disclose any information without verifying your identity and establishing that you are authorized to receive such data. This is done to protect the privacy and security of our clients' financial information. I understand this may be frustrating, but it's an important part of maintaining trust and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards. Is there anything else I can help you with?
